fields.description:
With the [integration between Slack and Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-cloud-for-slack-956709523.html], it is possible to include notifications when content is worked in Confluence (e.g. page edits and creation), but, there are no possibilities to do such actions directly from Slack to Confluence.

This is a suggestion to allow Slack to create pages and blogs in Confluence, directly through an option of the workspace.
fields.summary: Create page/blog from Slack

fields.description: Slack for Confluence needs to have the ability to create notifications in Slack when a user mention is created in Confluence, regardless of whether it is within a page or comment.
fields.summary: Slack for Confluence user mention notifications

fields.description:
Previews of Confluence pages don't show up in Slack automatically because users have not authorized it. However, it needs to be authorized on a per user basis. Even if you whitelist Confluence in Slack, it still requires tokenized authentication.

# User created a public slack channel
# User pasted the URL of a unrestricted Confluence page from our instance into the new channel
# Slack responded with a preview of the page.

This is the expected behavior if a user has already completed the Confluence-Slack integration.

Test with new user

I performed this test on the machine of one of my coworkers. She's neither an Admin in Slack nor an Admin in Jira/Confluence.

# create a public channel
# paste in a confluence URL
# get prompted to "link account"
# go through the linking process. she was able to do this but it's a ton of steps
# back to Slack to try again now that the user was authenticated in Slack
# finally, the preview shows up successfully

How can we improve this experience? Pre-auth? No-auth?

This is too many steps for users to go through if we want them to see Confluence URLs in Slack.

h3. Suggestions to improve work flow

- Allow for users who have never set up the app integration before to provision it directly from Confluence or Slack
- Allow the applications to implicitly trust each other and generate the link automatically
- Other solution which removes end user confusion (reduce amount of clicks and interaction dialogs to complete integration)
fields.summary: Improve Slack / Confluence integration pipeline

fields.description:
We use the slack integration with our cloud atlassian service desk.

We have a service status page, and whenever we edit it we get a slack message to our #general channel show that the Service status has changed.

But the notifications are not very useful:

!image-2019-08-08-17-28-59-057.png!

When publish changes you can say what you changed:

!image-2019-08-08-17-29-41-606.png!

It would be really good if this could be included (optionally) in the post. This way these messages on slack could be more useful:

"Wifi down...view status for more details".

"Wifi back up"
fields.summary: Conflunce cloud for Slack should have options to include the page change comment in the slack notification

fields.description:
h3. *Description*
Being able to use the Jira Cloud Add-on for Google sheet is a helpful way to be able to export thousands of issues at the same time rather than going through the 1K limit on Jira. However there are certain fields that can't get exported such as comment field. Basically this feature doesn't seem to exist yet for the Add-on.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use the guide here https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Try-the-new-Jira-Cloud-add-on-for-Google-Sheets/ba-p/1016436 to export your Jira Issues
# Use a Sample Jira function on Google Sheet as below
{code:sql}
=JIRA("project = AT2 order by created desc", "issuekey, summary, status, assignee, created, comment, priority, labels", 0, 1000)
{code}
# Notice the error *[can't parse subfield]*

h3. Expected
The comments should be exported separated by a comma, or each comment should have it's own column 

h3. Actual
The comment column has this error *[can't parse subfield]*

h3. Workaround
There is currently no workaround available
fields.summary: Google Sheet Add-on for Jira Cloud can't export Comment Field

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a Slack channel that has [Jira Cloud for Slack|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/jira-cloud-for-slack-950819031.html] installed, enter the following command and add a Jira project to channel
{code}
/jira connect
{code}
# In Jira, navigate to the project, click "Project settings" and scroll down

h3. Expected Results
"Slack integration" menu is shown

h3. Actual Results
"Slack integration" menu is not shown
 
h3. Workaround
Type "/jira manage" and access the link provided there
fields.summary: "Slack integration" menu not shown in the project sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At this moment, the {{/jira create}} command doesn't have the option to customize which fields will be filled during the creation of the issue.
h3. Suggested Solution

Would be useful if there was a way to set the form from the {{/jira create}} per project per channel
h3. Why this is important

That way, the issue created in Jira, through Slack, would be completed filled, not needing to enter the issue after its creation to provide more information not available in the creation from on Slack
fields.summary: Customize the fields from the create issue from Slack to Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * Jira Slack integration throwing error when duplicate custom field names exist
 * Affecting [Jira Server for Slack|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220099/jira-server-for-slack-official?hosting=server&tab=overview] version *2.0.1*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a Slack integration in Jira
 # Create duplicate custom field with the name 'Category' ((i) _Other duplicated custom fields are affected too_)
 # Configure the Notify Slack post-function

h3. Expected Results
Renderer works fine and notifications are sent correctly.
h3. Actual Results
 * The notification preview in Notify Slack post-function throws the following error:
{code:none}
Error rendering preview
Duplicate key JiraPostFunctionEventRenderer.CustomFieldWrapper(field=Category, issue=com.atlassian.jira.plugins.slack.web.rest.SlackMessageResource$1@432a38d8)
{code}

 * The notification in Slack breaks with the error
{quote}_Error in Notify Slack configuration for project XXX. Please contact your administrator to make sure that Notify Slack post-function comes after the issue creation._
{quote}

h3. Notes
The plugin pre-populates values of all custom fields for message rendering, thus it is breaking the rendering with the _Duplicate key_ error.

h3. Workaround
Do not use custom fields with the same name 
OR
Revert to the add-on's version *1.1.11* which is not affected from [here|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220099/jira-server-for-slack-official/version-history]
fields.summary: Having a duplicate custom field name breaks the Notify Slack post-function renderer and the notification

fields.description: Please implement the ability to notify users on mentions @ in the personal subscription.
fields.summary: Notify users on mentions @ in the personal subscription

fields.description: For the reference: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Try-Jira-Cloud-for-Outlook-Organize-your-work-without-leaving/ba-p/1081661#M1424]
fields.summary: Allow to directly install plugin to Outlook desktop client instead of to Outlook account

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion
Allow options to display all or filter and order issues from CRM
fields.summary: Allow options to display all or filter and order issues from CRM

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion
Allow options to create Jira issue via CRM
fields.summary: Allow Jira issue to be created via CRM Application

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion
Have an issue to be viewed at a Company-level to holistically view issues created by an organization
fields.summary: Company-level Issue view through the CRM

fields.description: Our Slack Enterprise Grid contains a over 10,000 instances, we already have a few dozen of these integrated into Jira. As such the selection menu has become very tedious to scroll through. We recommend a search box that would autocomplete workspace names and/or urls to improve both the load performance on this page and user experience.
fields.summary: Improved Slack Workspace Selection for Slack Official App

fields.description: As a Bamboo administrator, I would like to be able to install and use an official Slack integration app, developed by Atlassian.
fields.summary: Bamboo Server for Slack (Official)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the *Description* is hidden, the Slack app will be unable to create tickets on the project and will display a generic error message

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect a Jira project to your Slack.
# Go to your project's field configuration and hide the "Description" field
# On Slack, try creating a ticket using the "/jira create" command.

h3. Expected Results

The issue should be created successfully or the app should tell you that it is unable to fill the "Description" field.
h3. Actual Results

Slack will show the following error, even though there are no required fields.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Set the *Description* field as visible again.
fields.summary: Setting the Description field as hidden blocks issue creation via the Slack integration

fields.description: Currently there is an option to alert the slack channel when a comment is made. This alert is made when a comment is newly created but also when it is edited. We would like the option to ignore comment edits as this has become overly chatty. What would be best is if we could just have the slack alert show the edited comment in the same alert in slack, however I believe this likely is not possible, so instead a simple check box next to the “Someone Leaves A  Comment” setting to enable/disable alerts for edited comments.
fields.summary: As a user I want to ignore comment edits

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira Slack notification fail to send

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Integrate Jira to Slack
# Trigger a notification (Create, update, comment)

h3. Expected Results
The notification comes through to Slack

h3. Actual Results
No notification comes through on Slack

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Slack-Jira notifications fail to send with long summaries

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In a project that is integrated with Slack,
when adding comment with character `[ ]` would translate to < > in Slack

Notes:
It does not reciprocate from Slack to Jira

h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
 *
 *
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Integrate Jira project with Slack
 # Add a comment with text :
example `[ ]` test

h3. Expected Results
It should translate in slack as the same text

h3. Actual Results
We will get :
example < > test

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Using the character `[ ]` in Jira will translate to < > in Slack

fields.description:
The unfurl login prompt should have a “not now” button that will disable login prompts for 7 days.
*  !message.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Create ability to dismiss login prompt with "not now"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Users that are JSM customers on an instance can't connect the Jira Cloud for Outlook to the Instance since they don't have a license (JSM customer only).

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the JSM customer to connect the instance with the Jira Cloud for Outlook to open tickets, as they normally do in case they have product access (License) on the instance. 


h3. Why this is important

The Jira Cloud for Outlook is an add-on to help the users quickly open an issue in Jira. JSM customers should have this option as well.
fields.summary: Allow JSM customer to connect a Jira instance using the Jira Cloud for Outlook

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a new branch is created in Bitbucket and the Slack channel has subscribed to the commits_pushed webhook a message will display in Slack which always contains the top 5 commits on the branch whether or not they are new to the repo. 

t would be ideal if only new commits were displayed when a new branch is pushed. Raised from the community here: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/New-branch-notifications-in-Bitbucket-Cloud-for-Slack-have-too/qaq-p/1065630

 

See also: https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/event-payloads-740262817.html#EventPayloads-Push
h3. Environment

Bitbucket Cloud + Slack

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Push a commit to a branch, which contains only 1 commit

h3. Expected Results
Get a notification about 2 commits in Slack

h3. Actual Results
Getting a notification of 5 commits (2 from the branch + 3 from other branches)

h3. Workaround
None yet
fields.summary: Bitbucket for Slack includes historical commits on new branch push

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a space is integrated with the Confluence Slack plugin, editing a title of a page or a blog post will trigger a spam of multiple notifications to Slack.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Integrate Confluence with Slack using the Confluence Server for Slack (official) app
# Integrate a Confluence space to a Slack Channel. 
# In the Slack Integration settings in Confluence, ensure to set Notify this channel when
## Blog post is created
## Page is crated
## Page is updated
# Create a new page in the above space i.e. PageA and add some content. In my testing I added the following content in the page. 
{quote}
h5.The standard Lorem Ipsum passage, used since the 1500s \n\n "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam, quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. Duis aute irure dolor in reprehenderit in voluptate velit esse cillum dolore eu fugiat nulla pariatur. Excepteur sint occaecat cupidatat non proident, sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est laborum." h5. Section 1.10.32 of "de Finibus Bonorum et Malorum", written by Cicero in 45 BC \n\n "Sed ut perspiciatis unde omnis iste natus error sit voluptatem accusantium doloremque laudantium, totam rem aperiam, eaque ipsa quae ab illo inventore veritatis et quasi architecto beatae vitae dicta sunt explicabo. Nemo enim ipsam voluptatem quia voluptas sit aspernatur aut odit aut fugit, sed quia consequuntur magni dolores eos qui ratione voluptatem sequi nesciunt. Neque porro quisquam est, qui dolorem ipsum quia dolor sit amet, consectetur, adipisci velit, sed quia non numquam eius modi tempora incidunt ut labore et dolore magnam aliquam quaerat voluptatem. Ut enim ad minima veniam, quis nostrum exercitationem ullam corporis suscipit laboriosam, nisi ut aliquid ex ea commodi consequatur? Quis autem vel eum iure reprehenderit qui in ea voluptate velit esse quam nihil molestiae consequatur, vel illum qui dolorem eum fugiat quo voluptas nulla pariatur?" h5. 1914 translation by H. Rackham \n\n "But I must explain to you how all this mistaken idea of denouncing pleasure and praising pain was born and I will give you a complete account of the system, and expound the actual teachings of the great explorer of the truth, the master-builder of human happiness. No one rejects, dislikes, or avoids pleasure itself, because it is pleasure, but because those who do not know how to pursue pleasure rationally encounter consequences that are extremely painful. Nor again is there anyone who loves or pursues or desires to obtain pain of itself, because it is pain, but because occasionally circumstances occur in which toil and pain can procure him some great pleasure. To take a trivial example, which of us ever undertakes laborious physical exercise, except to obtain some advantage from it? But who has any right to find fault with a man who chooses to enjoy a pleasure that has no annoying consequences, or one who avoids a pain that produces no resultant pleasure?" h5 Section 1.10.33 of "de Finibus Bonorum et Malorum", written by Cicero in 45 BC \n\n "At vero eos et accusamus et iusto odio dignissimos ducimus qui blanditiis praesentium voluptatum deleniti atque corrupti quos dolores et quas molestias excepturi sint occaecati cupiditate non provident, similique sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollitia animi, id est laborum et dolorum fuga. Et harum quidem rerum facilis est et expedita distinctio. Nam libero tempore, cum soluta nobis est eligendi optio cumque nihil impedit quo minus id quod maxime placeat facere possimus, omnis voluptas assumenda est, omnis dolor repellendus. Temporibus autem quibusdam et aut officiis debitis aut rerum necessitatibus saepe eveniet ut et voluptates repudiandae sint et molestiae non recusandae. Itaque earum rerum hic tenetur a sapiente delectus, ut aut reiciendis voluptatibus maiores alias consequatur aut perferendis doloribus asperiores repellat." h5. 1914 translation by H. Rackham \n\n "On the other hand, we denounce with righteous indignation and dislike men who are so beguiled and demoralized by the charms of pleasure of the moment, so blinded by desire, that they cannot foresee the pain and trouble that are bound to ensue; and equal blame belongs to those who fail in their duty through weakness of will, which is the same as saying through shrinking from toil and pain. These cases are perfectly simple and easy to distinguish. In a free hour, when our power of choice is untrammelled and when nothing prevents our being able to do what we like best, every pleasure is to be welcomed and every pain avoided. But in certain circumstances and owing to the claims of duty or the obligations of business it will frequently occur that pleasures have to be repudiated and annoyances accepted. The wise man therefore always holds in these matters to this principle of selection: he rejects pleasures to secure other greater pleasures, or else he endures pains to avoid worse pains." 
{quote}
# The above will trigger a notification to Slack which is an expected behavior. 
# Edit the title of the page, this will result on multiple notifications spamming Slack.

 
h3. Expected Results

No notification is sent to Slack or only 1 notification sent explaining that the page has been updated.
h3. Actual Results
Slack is spammed with multiple *same* notification. The notifications are *update* notifications.

h3. Notes
* This is observed in Blogs as well. 
* The issue does not seem to happen if there are no content in the page. Editing the title with no content will only send out one update notification to Slack. 

h3. Workaround

No known workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Editing the title of a Confluence page will spam Slack with multiple notifications

fields.description: When configuring a new integration with Jira Cloud/Server by using the [Jira For Slack|[https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1216863/jira-cloud-for-slack-official]] app, it would be great if we could set the filters and define which issues should be notified directly in the Slack Channel, instead of navigating to the Jira integration page.
fields.summary: Ability to configure JIRA notification filters directly from Slack

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition
If your repositories have identical name it's impossible to select the proper repository in the Slack integration form.

h3. Example:
|Project Name | Repository Name|
| Client name A | Website |
| Client name B | Website |
| Client name C | Website |

The select will only show 3 entries named »Website«. This is also a flaw in the search of Bitbucket pull request form (at least you see the project name there).

h2. Suggested Solution
Prefix the repository with the project name.
fields.summary: Make repositories distinguishable by name in Slack integration form

fields.description:
h3. Summary
*issuelinks* support was added through the release in API-125 which adds an additional *Linked Issues* field to the Spreadsheet that provides the Issue key of the linked Issue.

 !Jira_test_Spreadsheet_-_Google_Sheets.png|thumbnail! 

However, this field is more effective when knowing that type of link the linked Issue has (blocker, is related to, duplicates, ect...).

h3. Propose solution
Include additional info to the *Linked Issues* field that specifies what type of link the Issue has.
fields.summary: Issue linking type or name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When configuring Slack notifications based on a JQL filter the user fields autocomplete is not working as desired. The autocomplete shows a fixed list of user and does not search based on user's input. Also, it is populating other add-on users which should be hidden.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Switch to JQL filter for configuring the notification.
 # try searching for users for user fields like assignee or reporter

h3. Expected Results

The autocomplete searches through the users in the site based on the user input.
h3. Actual Results

A fixed set of users is shown.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Autocomplete for user fields when using a JQL filter for Slack notifications is not working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Cloud for Outlook doesn't work for locally install outlook and Safari browser
h3. Environment
 * Safari
 * Microsoft Outlook
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Go to the marketplace and download the addon
 # Install the addon
 # Open from Safari
 # Noticed that the addon doesn't work for locally installed outlook

h3. Expected Results

The outlook addon should be showing Jira issues
h3. Actual Results

The outlook addon doesn't work
h3. Notes

For local Outlook installation, the icon shows but it's not present on the add-in list. 
 For Safari, there's a UI issue as well as the connection doesn't work for creating and view issues.
h3. Workaround
 * Use other browsers (Chrome or FireFox)
 * For local installation, no workaround at the moment. except if you use the Browser version.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud for Outlook doesn't work for locally install outlook and Safari browser

fields.description: The Jira cloud for sheets add-on does not support version picker (single version) field currently, it would be nice to have support for this field.
fields.summary: Support version picker field

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a space is integrated with the Confluence Slack plugin, editing a title of a page that has an Excerpt macro and that Excerpt macro is referenced by the Include Excerpt Macro in another page, will trigger a spam of multiple notifications to Slack.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Integrate Confluence with Slack using the Confluence Server for Slack (official) app
 # Integrate a Confluence space to a Slack Channel. 
 # In the Slack Integration settings in Confluence, ensue to set Notify this channel when
 ## Blog post is created
 ## Page is crated
 ## Page is updated
 # Create a new page in the above space i.e. PageA ( a notification will be sent to Slack) - expected behavior.
 # In that page add an Excerpt Macro and click save. ( a notification will be sent to Slack) - Expected behavior.
 # Create another page (PageB) and add an Include Excerpt Macro and reference this to the original excerpt macro in 5 above (PageA). (a notification will be sent to Slack) - expected behavior
 # Head over to the original Confluence page (PageA) that has the excerpt macro and edit  the title. 

h3. Expected Results

No notification is sent to Slack. 
h3. Actual Results

Slack is spammed with notifications. The notifications are combination of *create* and *edit* notifications that seems to originate from PageA and PageB.

The above behavior also if PageA excerpt is referenced by an Include Excerpt in a blog. 
h3. Workaround

No known workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Editing the title of a Confluence page that has Excerpt Macro, will spam Slack with multiple notifications

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When deleting a comment in a Jira instance with the [Jira Server for Slack|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220099/jira-server-for-slack-official?hosting=server&tab=support] Integration plugin, an error is generated in the logs related to a bug in the app code.

Jira Server for Slack app Version 1.1.11
Jira Server 7.8.2

No error is logged

at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.api.util.context.ReentrantThreadLocalBasedCodeContext.rteInvoke(ReentrantThreadLocalBasedCodeContext.java:137)
at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.api.util.context.ReentrantThreadLocalBasedCodeContext.runOutOfContext(ReentrantThreadLocalBasedCodeContext.java:90)
at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.utils.context.CustomerContextServiceImpl.runOutOfCustomerContext(CustomerContextServiceImpl.java:47)
at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.web.CustomerContextSettingFilter.outOfCustomerContext(CustomerContextSettingFilter.java:174)
at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.web.CustomerContextSettingFilter.doFilterImpl(CustomerContextSettingFilter.java:130)
at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.web.CustomerContextSettingFilter.doFilter(CustomerContextSettingFilter.java:121)
... 4 filtered
at com.atlassian.jwt.internal.servlet.JwtAuthFilter.doFilter(JwtAuthFilter.java:32)
... 8 filtered
at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.request.RedirectInterceptingFilter.doFilter(RedirectInterceptingFilter.java:21)
... 4 filtered
at com.atlassian.web.servlet.plugin.LocationCleanerFilter.doFilter(LocationCleanerFilter.java:36)
... 26 filtered
at com.atlassian.jira.servermetrics.MetricsCollectorFilter.doFilter(MetricsCollectorFilter.java:25)
... 23 filtered
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}

h3. Notes
Error in the code was found in {{com.atlassian.jira.plugins.slack.util.changelog}} > in the ChangeLogExtractor class:
- line 35: private static final String OLD_STRING_KEY_FOR_COMMENT = "oldalue";
- line 67: String oldStringKey = "Comment".equals(field) ? "oldalue" : "oldstring";

It should be *oldvalue* instead. Not sure if any other classes has this error as well.

h3. Workaround
Supress the ERROR level of logging if needed.
fields.summary: Deleting a comment generates an error in the logs related to Slack Integration

fields.description:
When the customer makes a COPY of an existing Sheet that had the Jira function enabled, it doesn't get enabled directly in the recent copied sheet (even after enable the Jira
function again in that new copy, using the =Jira function in the new copy
it won't work, even to make entirely different queries). 

This persists after clearing the cell, re-enter the formula, reload the page multiple times, etc.

The reason to do this is, for example, would be to re-use a template and all the
other Sheets formulas that are set up. So, having this feature on the Jira cloud for Google sheets would be very useful. 

At this moment, a workaround would be to create a new spreadsheet and copy/paste the data from the original spreadsheet.
fields.summary: Make a copy of a spreadsheet doesn't get the Jira function work directly

fields.description:
When configuring the [Confluence Server for Slack app|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220186/confluence-server-for-slack-official?hosting=server&tab=support], both help floating texts mention "Jira", instead of Confluence.

 !slack-text-error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Floating text in the Confluence Server for Slack app configuration mentions Jira, instead of Confluence

fields.description: Having a way to search Confluence directly from Slack using the integration app would be a good enhancement for the app's functionality. This is a popular feature on some of the other Marketplace apps that integrate Confluence with Slack, and is available on Atlassian's own integration app for Confluence Cloud; as such, extending Atlassian's official Confluence Server integration app to add this functionality as well could provide a lot of benefits for users of this integration.
fields.summary: Search feature on Slack for Confluence Server integration

fields.description:
Hi,

Creating this for an add-on developer:

JIRA Cloud has the right idea; we can say goodbye to blowing up mailboxes with JIRA emails. The problem is that it's currently impossible to only receive messages I care about, making the integration far less useful than it could be.

So what do I want?

I want to receive Slack messages for events which I care about, namely events on issues I'm watching and @mentions in issues I'm not watching. I also want to control whether all of those messages cause Slack notifications, or just @mentions.

Right now, @jirabot can't be configured to only send messages for events I care about. If I connect @jirabot using direct messages, for example, I get a notification for EVERY event in a project. Yes, I can customize @jirabot to only send certain types of issues, but the type of issue has no bearing on whether I'm watching it. That's a non-starter.

Instead of DM, I can create a Slack channel that receives all JIRA messages to avoid the flood of notifications, but that has the opposite problem. Nothing's ever a notification, even if I care about it, so events on the issues I watch never get noticed.

I think the right solution here is to be able to configure JIRA Cloud to send me only messages that affect me from the get-go, instead of making Slack trying to figure out what to notify on and what not to notify on.

Side note. One *stop-gap* solution I tried which didn't work was to send all JIRA messages to a single Slack channel, and try to get Slack to create notifications whenever my name appears using Slack highlight words. But this didn't work, even for explicit @mentions in JIRA issues. According to an email I got from Slack,

One thing to note: this highlight word limitation [not notifying] is for bot messages which originate from an incoming webhook. *Slack does recognize highlight words from a Bot User.* I'm not sure if you will be able to take advantage of Bot Users in your specific case, but it might be worth exploring. Here's some documentation about Bot Users ([https://api.slack.com/bot-users]) and you can add one to your team here: [https://my.slack.com/apps/A0F7YS25R-bots].

Even though JIRA Cloud is a bot user, highlight words didn't trigger notifications. At any rate, this would have only been a stop-gap solution, since a highlight word (my name) wouldn't necessarily show up in every message for every issue I'm watching. The right solution is to configure @jirabot.
fields.summary: Configure @jirabot to only send messages relevant to me

fields.description:
After installing the Jira sheets add-on and associate it to a sheet, the Jira instance selected is sticking across different sheets. For example, in case you work in more than one instance at the same time.

It would be great if the Jira sheets add-on has a setting to be stored in a single sheet the instance that is associated with it. So you can't accidentally change it and mix up data from two totally different projects or clients.
fields.summary: Separate Jira instance for each sheet tied to the Jira sheets add-on

fields.description:
Users want support for issuelinks in order to get a view of all the links that are associated with a ticket. The user who reported this feedback especially wants to know what the blockers are for a given task, all with a goal of *establishing operation priority*.

Workarounds being explored by this user include dependency visualizers found on the Atlassian marketplace:
 * [Issue Links Viewer | Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1216207/issue-links-viewer]
 * [Links Hierarchy Cloud - Epic & Portfolio | Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1212229/links-hierarchy-cloud-epic-portfolio]
 * [pawelrychlik/jira-dependency-graph: Graph visualizer for JIRA tickets’ dependencies|https://github.com/pawelrychlik/jira-dependency-graph]
 * [fadookie/jira-grapher: Tool to convert JIRA search results XML to DOT graph of blocker links|https://github.com/fadookie/jira-grapher]

Attached is a screenshot of what happens today when a ticket with issueLinks is ported in.
fields.summary: Support for IssueLinks in Sheets

fields.description: Add a feature to allow users to select the columns they want directly from the add-on instead of having to define them in a filter or in the custom function.
fields.summary: Ability to select columns directly in the add-on

fields.description: See more context here: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Connect-JIRA-to-Google-Sheets-via-JIRA-API/qaq-p/555259]
fields.summary: Support the "parent link" field in Jira Cloud for Sheets

fields.description:
Right now, the Jira Cloud for CRM supports only Salesforce, Microsoft Dynamics and Hubspot.
It would be good if it supported the CRM Copper.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud for CRM Add-on to Support Copper

fields.description:
We would like to create tickets with required fields using the command "/jira create".
Right now, it's not possible, failing the creation.
fields.summary: Provide Values for Required Fields Using the "/jira create" command of the Jira Cloud for Slack integration

fields.description:
Currently, the integration only detects issue mentions in public channels. This is by design.
However, there could at least an option to enable this for private channels.

Context: 4th comment in https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Connect-Jira-and-Confluence-Server-to-Slack-Today/ba-p/1008234
fields.summary: Save private channel mentions in Jira Server for Slack

fields.description:
Currently the integration supports disabling its Issue View sidebar panel (and thus dedicated channels) globally.
Ideally, admins should be allowed to choose at a project level.
fields.summary: Allow per-project sidebar configuration for Jira Server for Slack

fields.description:
Some teams would like issue previews to remain enabled, but find the unfurl in the channel to be too obtrusive or noisy.

*Suggestion*: Allow channels to toggle between replies in-channel, or threaded replies (reply in thread).
fields.summary: Post issue preview as reply in thread

fields.description: Currently, there is no functionality to configure slack notifications for scope change for sprints i.e when the sprint is created, updated, and deleted or other Jira Software events like version releases.
fields.summary: Slack notifications for Jira Software events

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup Slack integration using Jira Cloud for Slack
# In project setting, click "Slack integration" and toggle "Display Slack panel on issues in this project" off
# Reload the page

h3. Expected Results
"Display Slack panel on issues in this project" remains disabled

h3. Actual Results
"Display Slack panel on issues in this project" is automatically enabled
 
h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Unable to toggle "Display Slack panel on issues in this project" off

fields.description:
Supported notification triggers include issue created, issue updated, issue commented, issue transitioned to [workflow toggle].

*Suggestion*:

Add "issue moved" as a notification trigger that can be selected from the settings page.
fields.summary: "Move" issue notification for Jira

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure you have your account/site/project connected in the Slack channel
# Post a message
# From the three dots icon of 2, select "Add to issue Jira Cloud"
# Select an issue from the dropdown and click "Confirm"
# The following message is shown
{code}
Success! This message has been attached to <issue key>
{code}
# Click "Open issue"

h3. Expected Results
In the issue view, the issue is updated with the message

h3. Actual Results
The issue view is not updated
 
h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: In Slack integration, "Add to Issue" not working and issue doesn't get updated after clicking "Confirm"

fields.description:
At this moment, when a Slack user wants to add a Slack message to a Jira issue, it gets added in a separate section named _Slack messages_, visible in the bottom-right corner of the _view issue_ screen.

The Slack message should be added as a regular comment in the Jira issue.
fields.summary: Slack messages should be added in Jira as regular comments, not in a separate section

fields.description:
Currently, Jira Server for Slack (Official) app can create new slack channel in Jira but suggest to disable "Create new channel" option.

 !Screen Shot 2019-06-07 at 13.53.29.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Disable "Create new channel" option on Jira Server for Slack (Official) app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
An error saying *Something went wrong while creating an issue. Please try again later or contact support* is thrown by the *Jira Cloud for Outlook* app when either of the following scenarios occur:
# User adds a value longer than *255 characters* to any of the fields when *creating an issue*.
# User adds a *comment* longer than *32767 characters* when using the *send to issue* form

h3. Environment
 This applies to the [Jira cloud for Outlook (Official)|https://appsource.microsoft.com/en-us/product/office/WA200000056?tab=Overview] app

h3. Expected Results
Issue is created / comment is added. In case of failure, an error message providing more context around the problem should be returned (i.e. Value exceeded the maximum length)

h3. Actual Results
Error saying *Something went wrong while creating an issue. Please try again later or contact support* is thrown

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira for Outlook App throws an error for too large text fields

fields.description:
According to the Jira Server for Slack (Official) release note, channel picker have limit.
https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220099/jira-server-for-slack-official/version-history
{quote}Channel picker performance improved and limit increased to 30000 channels.{quote}

If we have more than 30000 channels, we can't set channel. It would be good if we can change this limit.

h3. Why this is important?
For big company, it easy to reach the 30000 channel limits.
fields.summary: Ability to change channel picker limit to more than 30000 channels

fields.description:
h3. Description
Currently, [Jira Server for Slack (Official)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220099/jira-server-for-slack-official?hosting=server&tab=overview] doesn't have any option to disable notifications for bulk operations.

For large instances, easily exceed Slack [Rate Limits|https://api.slack.com/docs/rate-limits] .
h3. Suggestion
Add option to disable notifications for bulk operations.
fields.summary: Ability to disable notifications for bulk operations to escape exceed rate limits on Slack

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

[Jira Server for Slack (Official)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220099/jira-server-for-slack-official] exceed Slack [Rate Limits|https://api.slack.com/docs/rate-limits] when access to setting screen if Slack have more than 10000 channels.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Integrate Jira with Slack that have more than 10000 channels
 * Open _Jira Administration > Applications > Slack_ with multiple tab at the same time

h3. Expected Results

All pages can load properly.
h3. Actual Results

Exceed [Rate Limits|https://api.slack.com/docs/rate-limits] and can't send notification to slack.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Jira Server for Slack (Official) exceed Slack Rate Limits when access to setting screen if Slack have more than 10000 channels

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When access to _Jira Administration > Applications > Slack_, {{/slack/channels}} time out if Slack have more than 10000 channels.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Integrate Jira with Slack that have 10000 channels
 * Go to _Jira Administration > Applications > Slack_

h3. Expected Results

All slack channels can load properly.
h3. Actual Results

{{/slack/channels}} API time out and can't get slack channel lists.
h3. Note

Takes time to load all channels around 30 sec ~ 60 sec.
h3. Workaround

Set properties to change timeout limit.
{code:java}
-Dslack.client.connect.timeout=10000-Dslack.client.read.timeout=60000{code}
fields.summary: Jira Server for Slack (Official) can't get slack channels due to time out if Slack have more than 10000 channels

fields.description:
When editing comments immediately after posting a new comment, for instance to fix  a typo, a notification is sent to the connected slack channel, causing unneeded noise.

 

As explained [here|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/How-to-disable-Slack-channel-notification-for-Jira-edit-comment/qaq-p/1003496], there should be a one hour period during which editing comments shouldn't cause a new notification, but it seems this isn't working.
fields.summary: Notification is *always* sent out after editing a comment

fields.description:
Hi JIRA, 

I wanted to ask about the requirements to integrate tenable.io with Jira cloud. 

At my company, we are currently utilizing Tenable.io as our vulnerability management scanning tool 

We are looking to up our security operations by integrating with our Jira cloud platform hopefully being able to automatically open tickets for vulnerabilities that Tenable identifies and close them once they have been resolved, providing a cohesive and trackable remediation process.

 

Currently, we are running: 
h2. License Information for Jira
h3. Jira fcba5718
h3. License Information for Jira Plugins

 Jira Service Desk Application 3.3.0-OD

JIRA Agile

 

Do you have any documentation on how to integrate the two platforms, Jira CLoud - Tenable.io? or is it even possible?
fields.summary: Tenable.io integration with Jira Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

* When using The Jira app for Slack (official) we are expecting that the Jira bot unfurl issues when a Jira issue key is mentioned. 
* However, when an issue key is posted by another App/bot, I can see that intentionally Jira bot is ignoring it and the issue key preview does not show up.
* I'm aware that it was configured by design to ignore other bots as it was the source of some incidents in the past. 

h3. Suggested Solution
* Provide a feature to whitelist bots. 
* Provide a feature to read whitelisted bots messages and unfurl the issue key when posted. 


h3. Why this is important
* More user friendly. 
* less time consuming. 
* better user experience. 
 
h3. Workaround 
* Manually type the issue key.
fields.summary: Jira for Slack app does not unfurl issues when the issue key is posted by another bot/app

fields.description:
h3. Summary  

 The Jira Slack notifications are missing the name of the user who performed the action.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure Slack notifications for a project. 
 # Ask a teammate to perform a transition or change the assignee of the issue.
 
h3. Expected Results

The notification shows the user who performed the action.
h3. Actual Results

The notification does not show the name of the user.
fields.summary: Jira notifications on Slack are missing the author name

fields.description:
Jira Server with the version 7.8.2 is integrated with Bitbucket. When we click pull request which is in Development ara of issue, we cannot configure pull request screen. 

For example, We want to add a column which shows yhe name of repository from Bitbucket. 

That is easy to see what the pull requests refer to.
fields.summary: Adding column to the Pull Request screen

fields.description:
h3. *Issue description*
Support for Salesforce Sandbox with the ira Cloud for CRM (Official) Add-On.
Currently, the Salesforce Sandbox is not supported by the CRM app, with Jira.

h3. *Steps to replicate*
 * [Create a Salesforce Sandbox|https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.apexcode.meta/apexcode/apex_intro_get_dev_account.htm]
 * Install the marketplace app [Jira Cloud for CRM (Official)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1217661/jira-cloud-for-crm-official?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] in Jira.
 * Navigate to _Project Settings -> CRM Integration_ and select _Salesforce_ and click _Continue_
 * Choose _Use Custom Domain_ and key in the domain of the sandbox environment created.
 * Proceed with allowing the permissions asked for.

h3. *Expected Results:*

Integration succeeds

h3. *Actual results:*
An authorization error appears.
fields.summary: Support for Salesforce Sandbox with the Jira Cloud for CRM (Official) Add-On

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it is not possible to set configuration for the Slack Integration to receive notifications for issue move event.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be good to have the possibility to configure to receive notifications when an issue is moved to another project.

h3. Workaround 
There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Slack integration does not have notification for issue move event

fields.description:
When a new branch is created in Bitbucket and the Slack channel has subscribed to the commits_pushed webhook a message will display in Slack which always contains the top 5 commits on the branch whether or not they are new to the repo. It would be ideal if only new commits were displayed when a new branch is pushed.  Raised from the community here: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/New-branch-notifications-in-Bitbucket-Cloud-for-Slack-have-too/qaq-p/1065630]

 

See also: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/event-payloads-740262817.html#EventPayloads-Push]
fields.summary: Bitbucket for Slack includes historical commits on new branch push
Support Jira Outlook for Jira Server/Data Center

fields.description:
Attempted to install Jira Cloud for Outlook, received error message: "Add-in failed to install. REST API is not yet supported for this mailbox".

Outlook v.1903 Build 11425.20202

Information I'm finding related to this error message indicates Outlook for Web, but the API install page appears to indicate desktop clients are supported.

**Please note: Component/s selection below does not have an available option for "Jira Cloud for Outlook"
fields.summary: Problem installing Jira Cloud for Outlook

fields.description:
Currently, when using the Slack for JIRA integration, you can set when a notification should be sent to Slack.

 !Screen Shot 2018-02-14 at 6.36.28 PM.png|thumbnail! 

As a user, I would also like to customize which fields will be displayed on Slack notifications.
fields.summary: JIRA for Slack integration: Ability to customize which fields will be displayed on Slack notifications

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In some cases, when importing data from Jira using the Jira Cloud <> Google Sheets integration, an issue that _has_ a value in the sprint field returns empty data instead.  This is caused because of newline characters appearing in the sprint description, perhaps in the "Goal" field.
h3. Expected Results

The sprint field should match what is reported by Jira's report functionality.
h3. Actual Results...

In some cases, the sprint field in the Sheet is blank or missing.  Also, in some cases a semicolon appears. 
h3. Workaround

Remove newlines from the sprint description.  An actual fix has been identified and a forthcoming release will fix the issue.
fields.summary: Importing sprint fields from Jira sometimes misses data

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 

It is not possible to fine-tune the notification for Slack integration via UI.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to general configuration > Slack integration
 # Map one Space to one Slack channel to test notifications
 # Tick all 4 available check-boxes
 # Create a Blog or a Page -> Notifications will work fine
 # Go back to Slack integration menu and untick notification for new Blog or new Page
 # Save
 # Create a new Blog and/or a new Page

h3. Expected Results

Notification will not be sent out according to your preferences
h3. Actual Results

The notification will be sent anyways
h3. Notes

Other combinations will not work as well, such as setting a new space-channel mapping and configuring only "page update" notifications, will result in no notifications at all.
h3. Workaround

There are no available workarounds at the moment.
fields.summary: Custom notification configuration doesn't work in Slack integration

fields.description:
Currently the add-on supports "epic link", which returns a key for the epic (if the issue is linked to an Epic)
Ideally we would return an epic object so users can do the following:

{{=JIRA("some jql", "key, summary, epic.summary, epic.key, epic.status")}}
h2. Workaround

This spreadsheet shows how to look up the epic name for each row in an import: [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1s55WjuhIitimkMdHdaP8beWJFczr0Ye2Hfys5u9fDec/edit?usp=sharing]
fields.summary: Return an "epic" object with details about the epic in Jira Cloud for Sheets

fields.description:
Jira Slack Bot integration does not honour the "global setting" which is set form JIra. Even if the user sets the below property from the personal settings, the user gets the slack notification for the changes made by the user:

 !Screen Shot 2019-05-06 at 11.01.11.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Slack does not respect the Global permission Set from Jira

fields.description:
We would like to have the option to disable the new notifications format from our Jira-Slack Integrations.
Our users were much more adapted to the old style.
fields.summary: Slack does not respect the Global permission Set from Jira

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Implementation of New Features Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features.
You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

It's not able to specify required field when creating an issue via Slack integration, so the integration complains an error below:

{code:none}
Oops! We tried to create an issue in Jira but weren't able to. Please try again or click the below button to manually create an issue.
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution

* Provide more specific error message instead of the current general message so that users can tell why the issue creation fails
* Display required fields in the create issue dialog.

h3. Workaround

Remove required constraint from fields preventing the issue creation.
Also, consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Ability to set required field via Slack integration

fields.description: a way to import issues in a spreadsheet, make changes and push them back to Jira
fields.summary: Bi-way sync for Jira Cloud for Sheets

fields.description: A few users have requested a way to bulk create issues from a spreadsheet (one issue per spreadsheet row)
fields.summary: A way to bulk create issues from a spreadsheet

fields.description:
Currently you can only query issue data (using a filter or JQL). 

Some users have reported wanting to query the Jira worklog too.
fields.summary: A way to query the worklog from the Jira Cloud for Google Sheets add-on
suggestion

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
We regularly create Jira projects and connect them to our Slack channels. Today, I created a project entitled "Project A" and successfully connected it to a channel in our Slack using jirabot. Shortly after, I created a project entitled "Project B." 
Following the same steps, I attempted to connect it to a different channel in our Slack, but it doesn't seem to work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project
 # Invite jirabot to the channel
 # I get the "Connect your Jira project" dialog
 # After selecting the project and the channel and clicking "Connect"

h3. Expected Results
It connects the channel to the project.

h3. Actual Results
It doesn't connect and doesn't throw nor error messages or success messages and When I then try the command "/jira manage", it says "I couldn't find any Jiras connected to this channel."

h3. Workaround
As a workaround, you can create a subscription from Jira. You need to go to the project config page, and this will have to be done by a Jira admin.
fields.summary: Attempt to Connect Jira Project to Slack Channel is Not Working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When first opening the sidebar in v1.5.0 of the add-on (Add-ons menu > Jira Cloud for Sheets > Open), the panel does not load in the sidebar and appears empty, except for the add-on name in the sidebar title.

*Notes*

This is a known issue associated with the latest major release ( v1.5.0).
h3. Workaround

Close and then re-open the sidebar.
fields.summary: Sidebar initially loads as empty after v1.5.0 release

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When using the Jira Cloud for Sheets add-on, as a document owner, I wanted to get the column referring to a custom field named "Target fix version" of type "version picker".

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

As an output, I got the message "[field not supported]" as shown in the screenshot.

I want to know which fields are currently not supported by the integration.
h3. Target solution

A "fields explorer" in the add-on. 
h3. Suggested Workaround

Provide on the reference documentation accessible through this [link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/jira-cloud-for-sheets-966051683.html] or on this public report, the list of non supported fields.
fields.summary: Provide a list of non supported fields by Jira Cloud for Sheets add-on

fields.description:
h2. *Shipped!*

*Good news! This feature has shipped to all customers and we have closed this issue.*

You can set up your personal notifications with these instructions:
 * In any Slack channel send a {{/jira notify}} message.
 * You will be prompted to select the Jira sites you would like to receive notifications for and the types of events you would like to be notified for. These options should be familiar if you have ever configured your Jira email notifications.
 * The personal notifications will come to you via a DM with the Jira bot user.
 ** Note: At this time Slack does not offer a way to control the "loudness" of these notifications so Slack will send alerts to you for every notification (like a DM with any other user).
 * If you would like to share feedback (good or bad) with us about this or any other feature you can always type {{/jira feedback}} we read all of your feedback and use it to help guide our decisions for future work.

Thank you for your patience while we built out this feature we hope you like it and find it useful.
h2. Original Issue Description

As a user, I would like to be notified in Slack when tickets that are associated with *me* (watching, assigned, reporter, etc. as options) have been modified.

 

Examples from other tickets:
 * _However we would like to ask whether it is possible to list the Jira issues that are currently assigned to you (for example all issues that are assigned to you and are in status In Progress) from SLACK?_
fields.summary: Personal Jira Notifications in Slack

fields.description:
Hi guys, 

 I'm writing you in regards of Jira and Slack integration (i.e. Jira Cloud Slack app)

 We are currently using that integration and it works perfectly.

 However we would like to ask whether it is possible to list the Jira issues that are currently assigned to you (for example all issues that are assigned to you and are in status In Progress) from SLACK?

 Is this currently possible and if not - can you implement it? Thank you in advance for your support.

 

Best,

 Dimo
fields.summary: Jira integration with SLACK

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Importing using a starred filters does not honor the "order by" clause defined in the filter.
h3.  

 
h3. Workaround

Until we fix this, you execute the filter's JQL query in add-on's JQL panel, in which case the "order by" clause is honored.
fields.summary: Imports using starred filters do not honor order by clause

fields.description:
We would like to have the option to disable the new notifications format from our Jira-Slack Integrations.
Our users were much more adapted to the old style.
fields.summary: Option to Disable the New Notifications Format on Slack-Jira Integration

fields.description:
When a JSD project is connected to a Slack channel, currently both external and internal comments are sent to the Slack channel if the user has subscribed the channel to "comment added" events.

The requirement is to enable the project administrator the ability to disable internal comment events, so that members of the channel that are connected to this JSD project do not see internal comments on the ticket, only external ones.
fields.summary: Disable internal comments on JSD project connections for Jira + Slack

fields.description:
The Epic fields currently returns inconsistent data (between Epic Name, Epic Links, etc.).

We'll implement better support for this
fields.summary: Better support for the Epic field in Jira for Sheets

fields.description:
Currently the add-on does not return the parent issue for a subtask.

The proposed solution is to return the "parent" object, as per the advanced fields documentation : [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-fields-reference-764478339.html |https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-fields-reference-764478339.html]

Which can be used like this:

{{=JIRA("project=TEST", "key, summary, parent.key, parent.summary")}}
fields.summary: Support for subtask parent in Jira Cloud for Sheets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the Jira Slack integration configuration page, the "issue transitioned to" checkbox allow to trigger notifications when the issue moves from a specific status to another. 

 !image-2019-04-09-16-37-32-078.png|thumbnail! 

As title of this report mentions, Issue transitioned drop down doesn’t work properly when top level checkbox is unchecked. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a subscription
# Uncheck the filter for “Issue transitioned to”
# Save it
# After it reloads, use the dropdown and check / uncheck
# Notice javascript errors

h3. Expected Results
* User can check the necessary checkboxes as per his needs. 

h3. Actual Results
* When the user interacts with the dropdown and the main checkbox is not selected a JS error is thrown. 

h3. Notes
* I made this short video to better describe the behavior and the possible workaround:  [^Recording #360.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
The Workaround is shown in the video (check the main checkbox first, then use the dropdown).
fields.summary: The slack integration Issue transitioned drop down doesn’t work properly when top level checkbox is unchecked

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Slack integration provides three configuration pages and a Slack panel: 

The first configuration page is accessible through the manage apps: 
* This page will enable or disable the Slack integration app from Jira side. 

The second configuration page is accessible through the project settings page: 
* This page will show all the Slack channels integrated with that specific project. 

The third configuration page is accessible by inserting the following from the Slack channel side: 

{code:java}
/jira manage
{code}
 
* This page will show the list of Jira projects integrated with that Slack channel. 


The Slack panel that we can find on the Jira issue view is supposed to show the list of messages added directly from the Slack channel. 

That being clarified, in some integrations we noticed that the second configuration page or the Slack panel are not showing up/not accessible. 

(We have an internal report tracking this behavior)

h3. Expected Results
See the three configuration pages and the Slack panel once the integration is made correctly. 


h3. Actual Results
in some integration we noticed that the second configuration page or the Slack panel are not showing up/ not accessible. 
 
h3. Notes
It was identified that flag isSlackEnabled is not set but toggle still shows that the integration is enabled (in the first configuration page mentioned above). 

h3. Workaround
Try to disable then enable Slack integration (in the first configuration page mentioned above)
fields.summary: I cannot see the Slack integration page or the Slack panel despite my slack integration being enabled

fields.description:
Our team went through a Hipchat -> Stride migration, only to be caught by surprise by the Atlassian/Slack partnership, and then have to switch from Stride -> Slack.

We had integrations we really liked between Jira and Hipchat, some which were out-of-the-box configurations, and some which involved custom scripting. We miss them!

The main one we need seems so basic: Just setting up a 1:1 association between a Jira issue and Slack channel. Updates to the issue, comments, subtask activity on the issue, etc. would be posted in the Slack channel.

We also used to have some conveniences like automatically creating the Hipchat room when an issue went to In Progress, automatically inviting team members for the assigned team into the new room, and automatically archiving it when the issue was closed. Unfurling of issue IDs in Hipchat rooms was nice, too.

I see that the Jira Server for Slack app ( [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220099/jira-server-for-slack-official?hosting=server&tab=overview] ) supports creating a connecting a dedicated channel to a Jira issue.

But we are using Jira Cloud, and the current "Jira Cloud for Slack" doesn't seem to enable specific issue-to-channel association.

Does anyone know if Is this a planned-for feature in Jira Cloud for Slack? We are currently using the third-party "Slack Jira Integration" app and aren't too happy with it.

 

source:[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Jira-Cloud-for-Slack-Support-for-connecting-a-specific-issue-to/qaq-p/1039678]
fields.summary: Dedicated Channels / Assign an Issue to a Channel

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Removing the Jira app from Slack Workspace will remove any subscription from all channels. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira app through the App page on Slack Workspace
 # On Slack Channel, add the Jira bot by typing @jira
 # Go back to Jira app page and uninstall from the workspace
 # Reinstall Jira app

h3. Expected Results
JIra Subscription settings *maintains* from Slack channels

h3. Actual Results
JIra Subscription settings are *removed* from Slack channels

h3. Workaround
Required, if there is no workaround please state:
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: all Jira subscription from channels are removed when the Jira App on Slack are uninstalled from Slack workspace

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition

After configuring integration with the CRM for Jira Cloud add-on (i.e., with Salesforce or Microsoft Dynamics), not all the fields are available for selection or if the field is available, there's an id instead of display value
h2. Suggested Solution

Provide a way to integrate all fields that users are expecting to leverage and indicate which fields did not come through after integration
fields.summary: As a Jira user, I cannot view all fields that refer to other CRM entities

fields.description:
This is very much a corner case, but would be nice-to-have under the following conditions:
 * The user requesting a Slack integration on a project is not an admin on that project (nor should become one)
 * The project admin is not a member of the private Slack channel the user is requesting
 * As Jira admin, I am also not necessarily a member of that private Slack channel, nor a Slack admin with privileges to see all Slack channels

Workaround: temporarily become a member of the private Slack channel, add the integration to the Project, and then leave the channel.
fields.summary: As a Jira Admin, in the Slack Jira integration I want to add Private Slack Channels to a Project when I nor the Project Admin are members of that channel
As a user I'd like the ability to import Jira issues into Sheets without adding header row

fields.description: Some users have been asking for a way to automatically refresh Jira data (either periodically or in real-time when the data changes in Jira) in the spreadsheet.
fields.summary: Ability to refresh Jira data periodically in Google Sheets

fields.description:
Several users have requested a way to refresh data imported from Jira in Google Sheets. 

We are currently planning to do this with an option to refresh all Jira data for a Sheet, triggered manually by the user.
fields.summary: Ability to refresh Jira data manually in Google Sheets

fields.description:
At this moment, the Jira add-on for Gmail supports creating issues only if the project and issue type support _inline create_. This excludes the existence of mandatory (required) custom fields.

Please consider supporting required custom fields for issue creation directly in the add-on.
fields.summary: support for issue creation with mandatory fields in add-on for Gmail

fields.description:
Please make it easier to search GIFs, say from GIPHY and easily send them. 

 

Also, emojis are so tiny. Please make them bigger.
fields.summary: Easy GIF integration and bigger Emoji size

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Mentions through the new issue view, as well as via the mobile app (iOS and Android) are shown as accountIDs on Slack channel instead of usernames.

h3. Environment

Jira + Slack integration.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Integrate Slack with a project;
# Mention a user using the mobile app or Jira *New issue View*;
# Check the Slack channel.

h3. Expected results

The Slack channel should show the username of the user.

h3. Actual result

The Slack channel shows the accountID (@accountid:838175:8bc118d1-4613-9b34-c15add9aad17).

h3. Workaround

- Mention Jira user through the old issue view.
- Mention the user via Jira on the mobile browser instead of the app.

h3. Notes

In Jira Sofware Projects, both the project's backlog and board use the New Issue View API, so they are also affected by this bug.
fields.summary: Mentions are shown as accountID on Slack

fields.description:
Jira Cloud for CRM is very good, however, we can only visualize 3 items under a project, which is bad, since when there are more than 3, the results come randomly.
We would like to have the option to configure more than 3 items per project.
fields.summary: Configure More than 3 Items under a Project Using CRM for Jira Cloud
Add option to import data on recurring schedule
